author: Staff Reporter
text:
Condemning the honour killing that took place in Udumalpet in Tirupur district recently, members of Democratic Youth Federation of India and All India Democratic Women’s Association demanded separate law to curb such incidents and staged a demonstration near the Collectorate here on Wednesday.

Members said that incidents of honour killings are on the rise in the State and recalled the murder of Gokulraj that took place last year. “Following the murder, we have been demanding a separate law to prevent such incidents. But, no law has been enacted so far,” they added.

The demonstrators said that every couple has every right to live in the society without fear and it is the duty of the State government to provide security to all. “Marriage is by one’s wish and no one can prevent it,” they added. They said that the recent incident of the youth murdered in full public view is barbaric and demanded stringent punishment for the accused. “Only a separate law with stringent punishment would prevent honour killings,” they added. The members also wanted compensation for the victim’s wife and a government job for her so that she could lead a life.
title: Separate law sought to curb honour killings
